level_support_sentences: This helps diversify income sources, providing important financial security as demand for native timber declines, while improving the region's environmental integrity.

The project will also enhance local biodiversity—undermined by harvesting events and practices—diversify landowners’ income, and maintain both the aesthetic and recreational values of the Tasmanian landscape.
Moreover, these projects create alternative employment sources, including fieldwork to assess and monitor forests protected under VCS IFM projects.
The project activity generates income only from the sale of carbon credits.
Proponents will benefit from an increasingly educated network as more landowners adopt carbon-financed Improved Forest Management to generate revenue while enhancing privately owned native forests.

Moreover, these projects create alternative employment sources, including fieldwork to assess and monitor forests protected under VCS IFM projects.

Regarding local community benefits, retaining native forest yields a wide range of benefits, including but not limited to: • Protection of water quality; • Pest and disease control for nearby agricultural activities; • Aesthetic benefits from forest retention; • Broader benefits from avoiding CO₂ emissions.

The project will also enhance local biodiversity—undermined by harvesting events and practices—diversify landowners’ income, and maintain both the aesthetic and recreational values of the Tasmanian landscape.
Moreover, these projects create alternative employment sources, including fieldwork to assess and monitor forests protected under VCS IFM projects.
The local community benefits from conserving the native forest.
The owners seek an alternative that will provide comparable income while protecting and improving the native forests of the region.
The project activity generates income only from the sale of carbon credits.
This will deter landowners from either ongoing selective logging or converting native forests to plantations or pasture to compensate for the declining revenue from logging.
